title: Parks are for people, but...
subject_group: Anthropology, Ethnology, Exploration & Travel/Kosciusko National Park (N.S.W.)
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/Environmental protection
Climate, Environment, Natural Resources & Disasters/National parks and reserves - Australia
description: Considers some of the environmental problems resulting from the use of parks by people in their various activities. Takes, as an example, Kosciusko State Park in the Snowy Mountains and the problems it represents for the management of the park. Cast includes Margaret Newport, Frances Miller, Anne Miller, Geoff Drummond, Peter Hunt, Pat Drummond. Director, photographer, editor: Damon Smith; photographer: Karen Wynn; sound: Peter Moylan; music: Pat Drummond, Peter Hunt; songs: John Polson; commentary: Martin Williams.
